item.title: Introduction
item.description: Python Bootcamp Zero to Hero Udemy python2 vs python3 python 2 python 2 was started in 2000 python 2.7 was released in mid 2010 will loose support for security updates in 2020 python 3 released in 2008 more and more libraries are beginning to support but not all which one to choose ?? both they are very similar with key differences Majority of people are using python 2.

item.title: Objects_ds_basics
item.description: lot of types of numbers in python like integers : 1 ,3, 2 floating point numbers : 2.1, -1.23 , 4E2 In python 2, it does classic division means decimal points gets truncated off 3/2 = 1 How can we make it do true division , atleast make sure one is floating point number 3.0/2 = 1.5 3/2.0 = 1.5 Cast of them to float
